elements.title: korowai gecko (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that off-roading at Muriwai Beach in New Zealand may be damaging the habitat of the newly described korowai gecko (example pictured)?

elements.title: horsegiirL (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after criticising horsegiirL's "My Barn My Rules" live on air, the British DJ Arielle Free was suspended from BBC Radio 1 for a week?

elements.title: Andrew Carnegie Mansion (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Andrew Carnegie Mansion in New York City was designed by "the only architects in the city who had not begged for the job"?

elements.title: Marcos G. McGrath (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Marcos G. McGrath, the Catholic archbishop of Panama, was allowed to enter Manuel Noriega's "witch house" and other residences, and found evidence of torture, devil worship, and voodoo?

elements.title: Chicago Community Bond Fund (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Chicago Community Bond Fund sought to put itself out of business by eliminating cash bail?

elements.title: Dave Jamerson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Dave Jamerson was the first NCAA Division I men's basketball player to make 14 three-point shots in a game?

elements.title: Facts (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Nicki Minaj, who receives a shoutout from Ben Shapiro in his song "Facts", congratulated him when it reached number one on the iTunes chart?

elements.title: a Miami TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a Miami TV station built a news set atop a wooden conference room table?
